tool_description: View a specific reminder by its title.

title.description: The title of the reminder to search for.

usage: View a specific reminder by its title.
meta_data:
```yaml
system_state:
  wifi: false  # Global system state - network connectivity
  logged_in: true  # Global system state - user authentication status
  max_capacity: 6  # Global constant - maximum number of reminders allowed
  reminder_id_counter: 3  # Global counter - tracks next available reminder ID

entities:
  reminders:
    1:
      reminder_id: 1001
      title: "Doctor's Appointment"
      description: "Visit Dr. Smith for a checkup."
      time: "2024-07-15 09:30"
      notified: false
    2:
      reminder_id: 1002
      title: "Team Meeting"
      description: "Monthly project review with the team."
      time: "2024-07-17 11:00"
      notified: false
    3:
      reminder_id: 1003
      title: "To-do list"
      description: "First, help Frank place a food delivery order at \"Hema Fresh,\" ordering two \"Fresh Gift Packs.\" Then, send a message to Frank saying, \"The price of the purchased goods is () yuan.\" Replace the parentheses with the actual amount, keeping one decimal place."
      time: "2024-07-16 11:00"
      notified: false

initial_data:
  reminder_collection:
    1001:
      reminder_id: 1001
      title: "Doctor's Appointment"
      description: "Visit Dr. Smith for a checkup."
      time: "2024-07-15 09:30"
      notified: false
    1002:
      reminder_id: 1002
      title: "Team Meeting"
      description: "Monthly project review with the team."
      time: "2024-07-17 11:00"
      notified: false
    1003:
      reminder_id: 1003
      title: "To-do list"
      description: "First, help Frank place a food delivery order at \"Hema Fresh,\" ordering two \"Fresh Gift Packs.\" Then, send a message to Frank saying, \"The price of the purchased goods is () yuan.\" Replace the parentheses with the actual amount, keeping one decimal place."
      time: "2024-07-16 11:00"
      notified: false

tool_mapping:
  view_reminder_by_title:
    api_method: "view_reminder_by_title"
    parameter_mapping:
      title: "title"
    validation_chain:
      - "Step 1: Check if device is logged in"
      - "Step 2: Validate title parameter is string"
      - "Step 3: Search for reminder with matching title"
      - "Step 4: Return reminder details or not found message"
    supported_parameter_ranges:
      title:
        valid_values: ["Any string value"]
        constraints: "Must be a string, case-sensitive exact match"
        edge_cases: "Empty string, None, or non-existent titles return not found message"

  add_reminder:
    api_method: "add_reminder"
    parameter_mapping:
      title: "title"
      description: "description"
      time: "time"
    validation_chain:
      - "Step 1: Check if device is logged in"
      - "Step 2: Check if reminder capacity is available"
      - "Step 3: Validate all required parameters"
      - "Step 4: Increment reminder_id_counter"
      - "Step 5: Create new reminder entry"
    supported_parameter_ranges:
      title:
        valid_values: ["Any string value"]
        constraints: "Required string parameter"
        edge_cases: "Empty string accepted, None causes error"
      description:
        valid_values: ["Any string value"]
        constraints: "Required string parameter"
        edge_cases: "Empty string accepted, None causes error"
      time:
        valid_values: ["datetime object or string in format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM"]
        constraints: "Required datetime parameter"
        edge_cases: "Invalid datetime format causes error"

  delete_reminder:
    api_method: "delete_reminder"
    parameter_mapping:
      reminder_id: "reminder_id"
    validation_chain:
      - "Step 1: Check if device is logged in"
      - "Step 2: Validate reminder_id is integer"
      - "Step 3: Check if reminder_id exists in reminder_list"
      - "Step 4: Remove reminder from reminder_list"
    supported_parameter_ranges:
      reminder_id:
        valid_values: ["Positive integers corresponding to existing reminder keys"]
        constraints: "Must be integer, must exist in reminder_list"
        edge_cases: "Non-existent IDs, negative numbers, non-integers return error"

  view_all_reminders:
    api_method: "view_all_reminders"
    parameter_mapping: {}
    validation_chain:
      - "Step 1: Check if reminder_list is empty"
      - "Step 2: Extract reminder details (excluding reminder_id)"
      - "Step 3: Return formatted list of reminders"
    supported_parameter_ranges: {}

function_behaviors:
  view_reminder_by_title:
    prerequisites:
      - "System must have logged_in = True"
    validation_rules:
      - "Title parameter must be provided as string"
      - "Title matching is case-sensitive and exact"
    success_conditions:
      - "Device is logged in and title matches existing reminder"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "Device not logged in"
        message: "The device is not logged in, so you cannot view notifications"
        tool_impact: "Returns status: false with error message"
      - condition: "No reminder found with specified title"
        message: "No reminder found with the title '{title}'."
        tool_impact: "Returns status: false with not found message"
    state_changes:
      - "No state changes - read-only operation"
    parameter_handling:
      - "Missing title parameter causes method error"
      - "Empty title string searches for reminder with empty title"
      - "Case-sensitive exact string matching"

  add_reminder:
    prerequisites:
      - "System must have logged_in = True"
      - "Reminder count must be less than max_capacity (6)"
    validation_rules:
      - "All parameters (title, description, time) are required"
      - "Title and description must be strings"
      - "Time must be datetime object"
    success_conditions:
      - "Device logged in, capacity available, valid parameters"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "Device not logged in"
        message: "Device not logged in. Unable to add a new reminder."
        tool_impact: "Returns status: false with login error"
      - condition: "Reminder capacity full (6+ reminders)"
        message: "Reminder capacity is full. Unable to add a new reminder."
        tool_impact: "Returns status: false with capacity error"
    state_changes:
      - "Increments reminder_id_counter by 1"
      - "Adds new reminder to reminder_list with new counter value as key"
      - "Sets notified: false for new reminder"
    parameter_handling:
      - "All parameters are required - missing parameters cause error"
      - "Time parameter stored as provided (datetime or string)"
      - "Generated reminder_id uses incremented counter, not provided ID"

  delete_reminder:
    prerequisites:
      - "System must have logged_in = True"
      - "Reminder with specified ID must exist"
    validation_rules:
      - "reminder_id must be integer"
      - "reminder_id must exist as key in reminder_list"
    success_conditions:
      - "Device logged in and valid reminder_id provided"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "Device not logged in"
        message: "Device not logged in. Unable to delete the specified reminder."
        tool_impact: "Returns status: false with login error"
      - condition: "Reminder ID does not exist"
        message: "Reminder ID does not exist."
        tool_impact: "Returns status: false with ID error"
    state_changes:
      - "Removes reminder entry from reminder_list"
      - "Does not modify reminder_id_counter"
    parameter_handling:
      - "reminder_id must be provided as integer"
      - "Non-existent IDs return specific error message"

  view_all_reminders:
    prerequisites:
      - "No login requirement for this method"
    validation_rules:
      - "No parameter validation required"
    success_conditions:
      - "At least one reminder exists in reminder_list"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "No reminders in reminder_list"
        message: "No reminders found."
        tool_impact: "Returns status: false with no reminders message"
    state_changes:
      - "No state changes - read-only operation"
    parameter_handling:
      - "No parameters required"
      - "Returns simplified reminder format without reminder_id field"

constraints:
  data_formats:
    - "reminder_id: integer (auto-generated, starts from 4 for new reminders)"
    - "title: string (any length, case-sensitive)"
    - "description: string (any length, supports multi-line)"
    - "time: string in 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM' format or datetime object"
    - "notified: boolean (always false for new reminders)"
  
  capacity_limits:
    - "Maximum 6 reminders total (max_capacity = 6)"
    - "reminder_id_counter increments sequentially, starts at 3"
  
  business_rules:
    - "Login required for view_reminder_by_title, add_reminder, delete_reminder"
    - "No login required for view_all_reminders"
    - "Title matching is case-sensitive and exact"
    - "New reminders always created with notified: false"
  
  validation_patterns:
    - "reminder_id: Must be integer, must exist in reminder_list keys"
    - "title: String matching is exact and case-sensitive"
    - "All required parameters must be provided"
  
  state_scope_clarifications:
    - "logged_in: Global system state affecting most operations"
    - "wifi: Global system state (present but not used in current methods)"
    - "max_capacity: Global constant, unchangeable"
    - "reminder_list: Global collection indexed by sequential integers"
    - "reminder_id_counter: Global counter, only increments on add_reminder"
  
  tool_parameter_constraints:
    - "title parameter: Required string, case-sensitive matching"
    - "reminder_id parameter: Must be existing key in reminder_list"
    - "time parameter: Accepts datetime object or formatted string"
    - "No optional parameters - all method parameters are required"

comprehensive_coverage:
  edge_cases:
    - scenario: "Tool called with non-existent reminder_id"
      api_response: "{status: false, message: 'Reminder ID does not exist.'}"
    - scenario: "Tool called when device not logged in"
      api_response: "{status: false, message: 'Device not logged in. Unable to [operation].'}"
    - scenario: "Add reminder when at capacity (6 reminders)"
      api_response: "{status: false, message: 'Reminder capacity is full. Unable to add a new reminder.'}"
    - scenario: "View reminder by title when title doesn't exist"
      api_response: "{status: false, message: 'No reminder found with the title \\'[title]\\\'.'}"
    - scenario: "View all reminders when list is empty"
      api_response: "{status: false, message: 'No reminders found.'}"
  
  parameter_exhaustiveness:
    entity_reference_coverage:
      - "Valid reminder_ids: 1, 2, 3 (initial state)"
      - "Valid titles: 'Doctor\\'s Appointment', 'Team Meeting', 'To-do list'"
      - "Invalid reminder_ids: Any integer not in reminder_list keys"
      - "Invalid titles: Any string not exactly matching existing titles"
      - "Case sensitivity: 'doctor\\'s appointment' != 'Doctor\\'s Appointment'"
    
    parameter_interactions:
      - "login state affects all operations except view_all_reminders"
      - "capacity check occurs before parameter validation in add_reminder"
      - "reminder_id must exist for delete_reminder to succeed"
  
  state_dependencies:
    - "logged_in = false: Blocks view_reminder_by_title, add_reminder, delete_reminder"
    - "logged_in = true: Allows all operations subject to other constraints"
    - "reminder_list length >= 6: Blocks add_reminder regardless of login state"
    - "reminder_list empty: Causes view_all_reminders to return no results"
    - "wifi state: Present in system but does not affect any current operations"
```
```yaml
system_state:
  wifi: false  # Global system state - affects all tool operations
  logged_in: true  # Global authentication state - affects all tool operations
  # Scope: Global per-session - maintains state across all tool calls within a session

entities:
  # No explicit entities defined in this API - operates on global system state only

initial_data:
  # No persistent data collections - API operates purely on system state

tool_mapping:
  turn_on_wifi:
    api_method: "turn_on_wifi"
    parameter_mapping:
      # This tool takes no parameters - direct method call
    validation_chain:
      - "Step 1: Validate method exists and is callable"
      - "Step 2: Execute wifi state change operation"
      - "Step 3: Return success response with status and message"
    supported_parameter_ranges:
      # No parameters accepted - any parameters passed will be ignored

  login_device:
    api_method: "login_device"
    parameter_mapping:
      # This tool takes no parameters - direct method call
    validation_chain:
      - "Step 1: Validate method exists and is callable"
      - "Step 2: Execute login state change operation"
      - "Step 3: Return success response with status and message"
    supported_parameter_ranges:
      # No parameters accepted - any parameters passed will be ignored

function_behaviors:
  turn_on_wifi:
    prerequisites:
      - "No prerequisites - can be called in any system state"
      - "Method exists and is accessible"
    validation_rules:
      - "No parameter validation - method accepts no parameters"
      - "No authentication checks - operates regardless of logged_in state"
    success_conditions:
      - "Method executes without exception"
      - "Returns dictionary with 'status': True and 'message' fields"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "Method called on invalid API instance"
        message: "AttributeError or similar Python exception"
        tool_impact: "Tool call fails with system error"
      - condition: "Unexpected system exception during execution"
        message: "Python exception details"
        tool_impact: "Tool call fails with system error"
    state_changes:
      - "Sets self.wifi = True regardless of previous state"
      - "No other system state modifications"
    parameter_handling:
      - "Ignores all parameters - method signature accepts none"
      - "No validation required for parameters"
      - "Excess parameters are silently ignored"

  login_device:
    prerequisites:
      - "No prerequisites - can be called in any system state"
      - "Method exists and is accessible"
    validation_rules:
      - "No parameter validation - method accepts no parameters"
      - "No authentication checks - can be called regardless of current login state"
    success_conditions:
      - "Method executes without exception"
      - "Returns dictionary with 'status': True and 'message' fields"
    error_conditions:
      - condition: "Method called on invalid API instance"
        message: "AttributeError or similar Python exception"
        tool_impact: "Tool call fails with system error"
      - condition: "Unexpected system exception during execution"
        message: "Python exception details"
        tool_impact: "Tool call fails with system error"
    state_changes:
      - "Sets self.logged_in = True regardless of previous state"
      - "No other system state modifications"
    parameter_handling:
      - "Ignores all parameters - method signature accepts none"
      - "No validation required for parameters"
      - "Excess parameters are silently ignored"

constraints:
  data_formats:
    - "Response format: {'status': boolean, 'message': string}"
    - "No input format constraints - no parameters accepted"
  capacity_limits:
    - "No capacity limits defined"
    - "No rate limiting implemented"
  business_rules:
    - "WiFi can be turned on regardless of current state (idempotent)"
    - "Login can be performed regardless of current login state (idempotent)"
    - "No interdependencies between wifi and login states"
  validation_patterns:
    - "No input validation - methods accept no parameters"
    - "All validation occurs at method existence level only"
  state_scope_clarifications:
    - "All state is global per API instance"
    - "No user-specific or session-specific state beyond instance level"
    - "State persists until instance is destroyed or _load_scenario is called"
    - "No authentication scope - logged_in is binary global state"
  tool_parameter_constraints:
    - "No parameters accepted by any tool"
    - "Any parameters passed to tools will be ignored"
    - "No cross-parameter dependencies exist"

comprehensive_coverage:
  edge_cases:
    - scenario: "Tool called with unexpected parameters"
      api_response: "Parameters ignored, normal execution proceeds"
    - scenario: "Tool called multiple times consecutively"
      api_response: "Idempotent behavior - same success response each time"
    - scenario: "Tool called when already in target state (wifi=True for turn_on_wifi)"
      api_response: "Success response - sets state to True regardless of current value"
    - scenario: "Tool called when already in target state (logged_in=True for login_device)"
      api_response: "Success response - sets state to True regardless of current value"
    - scenario: "API instance not properly initialized"
      api_response: "AttributeError or similar Python exception"

  parameter_exhaustiveness:
    entity_reference_coverage:
      - "No entity references supported"
      - "No identifiers to validate"
    parameter_interactions:
      - "No parameter interactions - no parameters accepted"
      - "No validation order dependencies"

  state_dependencies:
    turn_on_wifi:
      - "Independent of current wifi state (True or False)"
      - "Independent of logged_in state"
      - "Always succeeds and sets wifi=True"
    login_device:
      - "Independent of current logged_in state (True or False)"
      - "Independent of wifi state"
      - "Always succeeds and sets logged_in=True"

  response_format_specification:
    turn_on_wifi:
      success_response:
        status: true
        message: "Wi-Fi has been turned on"
      response_type: "Dictionary with boolean 'status' and string 'message'"
    login_device:
      success_response:
        status: true
        message: "Device has been logged in"
      response_type: "Dictionary with boolean 'status' and string 'message'"

  method_idempotency:
    - "turn_on_wifi: Idempotent - multiple calls produce same result"
    - "login_device: Idempotent - multiple calls produce same result"
    - "Both methods always return success and set target state to True"

  scenario_loading_behavior:
    - "_load_scenario can override default states"
    - "wifi defaults to scenario.get('wifi', False)"
    - "logged_in defaults to scenario.get('logged_in', True)"
    - "Scenario loading affects initial state but not tool behavior patterns"
```
SYSTEM STATE
{
  wifi: false,            // default on __init__
  logged_in: true         // default on __init__
}


USERS/ENTITIES
{
  device: {
    type: "BaseApi",
    attributes: {
      wifi: boolean,
      logged_in: boolean
    }
  }
}


INITIAL DATA
{
  device_state: {
    wifi: false,
    logged_in: true
  },
  records: []
}


CONSTRAINTS
{
  state_model: {
    wifi: {type: boolean, values: [true, false], default: false},
    logged_in: {type: boolean, values: [true, false], default: true}
  },

  scenario_loader: {
    method: "_load_scenario(scenario: dict, long_context: bool=false)",
    input: {
      scenario?: {wifi?: boolean, logged_in?: boolean},
      long_context?: boolean  // ignored
    },
    behavior: [
      "wifi := scenario.wifi if defined else false",
      "logged_in := scenario.logged_in if defined else true",
      "unknown scenario keys ignored"
    ],
    errors: "none"
  },

  operations: [
    {
      name: "turn_on_wifi()",
      requires → none,
      effects → {wifi: true},
      returns → {status: true, message: "Wi-Fi has been turned on"},
      notes: ["idempotent"]
    },
    {
      name: "login_device()",
      requires → none,
      effects → {logged_in: true},
      returns → {status: true, message: "Device has been logged in"},
      notes: ["idempotent"]
    }
  ],

  business_rules: [
    "wifi and logged_in are independent",
    "no operation to disable wifi or log out"
  ],

  formats: {
    booleans: "Python bool (true/false)",
    return_object: {status: boolean, message: string},
    strings: "exact-case messages as defined"
  },

  operational_limits: [
    "single in-memory device instance",
    "no persistence across instances",
    "deterministic, synchronous",
    "no error states defined in methods"
  ]
}
SYSTEM STATE:
{
  "max_capacity": 6,
  "wifi": false,  // default via _load_scenario(..., {"wifi": False})
  "logged_in": true,  // default via _load_scenario(..., {"logged_in": True})
  "message_id_counter": 6
}

USERS/ENTITIES:
{
  "User": {
    "fields": ["name", "user_id", "phone_number", "occupation"]
  },
  "PredefinedUsers": [
    {"name": "Eve",   "user_id": "USR100", "phone_number": "123-456-7890", "occupation": "Software Engineer"},
    {"name": "Frank", "user_id": "USR101", "phone_number": "234-567-8901", "occupation": "Data Scientist"},
    {"name": "Grace", "user_id": "USR102", "phone_number": "345-678-9012", "occupation": "Product Manager"},
    {"name": "Helen", "user_id": "USR103", "phone_number": "456-789-0123", "occupation": "UX Designer"},
    {"name": "Isaac", "user_id": "USR104", "phone_number": "567-890-1234", "occupation": "DevOps Engineer"},
    {"name": "Jack",  "user_id": "USR105", "phone_number": "678-901-2345", "occupation": "Marketing Specialist"}
  ],
  "Message": {
    "fields": ["id", "sender_id", "receiver_id", "message", "time?"],
    "time_format": "YYYY-MM-DD",
    "note": "\"time\" present in initial records; send_message() does not set \"time\""
  }
}

INITIAL DATA:
{
  "inbox": {
    "1": {
      "sender_id": "USR100",
      "receiver_id": "USR101",
      "message": "Hey Frank, don't forget about our meeting on 2024-06-11 at 4 PM in Conference Room 1.",
      "time": "2024-06-09"
    },
    "2": {
      "sender_id": "USR101",
      "receiver_id": "USR102",
      "message": "Can you help me order a \"Margherita Pizza\" delivery? The merchant is Domino's.",
      "time": "2024-03-09"
    },
    "3": {
      "sender_id": "USR102",
      "receiver_id": "USR103",
      "message": "Please check the milk tea delivery options available from Heytea and purchase a cheaper milk tea for me. After making the purchase, remember to reply to me with \"Already bought.\"",
      "time": "2023-12-05"
    },
    "4": {
      "sender_id": "USR103",
      "receiver_id": "USR102",
      "message": "No problem Helen, I can assist you.",
      "time": "2024-09-09"
    },
    "5": {
      "sender_id": "USR104",
      "receiver_id": "USR105",
      "message": "Isaac, are you available for a call?",
      "time": "2024-06-06"
    },
    "6": {
      "sender_id": "USR105",
      "receiver_id": "USR104",
      "message": "Yes Jack, let's do it in 30 minutes.",
      "time": "2024-01-15"
    }
  }
}

CONSTRAINTS:
{
  "scenario_loading": {
    "_load_scenario(scenario: dict, long_context: bool=False) → None": {
      "sets": {
        "wifi": "scenario.get(\"wifi\", False)",
        "logged_in": "scenario.get(\"logged_in\", True)"
      }
    }
  },

  "capacity_rules": [
    "len(inbox) ≤ max_capacity",
    "initial: len(inbox)=6 → inbox is full; send_message() will fail until a message is deleted"
  ],

  "identifiers": {
    "user_name_keys": ["Eve","Frank","Grace","Helen","Isaac","Jack"],
    "user_id_values": ["USR100","USR101","USR102","USR103","USR104","USR105"],
    "message_id": "int, dict key in inbox; message_id_counter starts at 6 and increments by 1 on send"
  },

  "time_rules": [
    "time string format: \"%Y-%m-%d\"",
    "get_latest_message_id() and get_earliest_message_id() parse all messages' time",
    "get_all_message_times_with_ids() expects every inbox message to contain \"time\"",
    "send_message() does not set \"time\" → calling time-based methods after new sends may error"
  ],

  "auth_connectivity": [
    "logged_in required: send_message, delete_message, view_messages_between_users, get_all_message_times_with_ids, get_latest_message_id, get_earliest_message_id",
    "wifi required: send_message only"
  ],

  "methods": {
    "send_message(sender_name: str, receiver_name: str, message: str) → {\"status\": bool, \"message\": str}": [
      "requires: logged_in==True → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"Device not logged in, unable to send message\"}",
      "requires: wifi==True → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"Wi-Fi is turned off, cannot send messages at this time\"}",
      "requires: len(inbox) < max_capacity → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"Inbox capacity is full. You need to ask the user which message to delete.\"}",
      "requires: sender_name ∈ user_name_keys AND receiver_name ∈ user_name_keys → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"Sender or receiver does not exist\"}",
      "on_success: increment message_id_counter; inbox[message_id_counter]={\"sender_id\": sender.user_id, \"receiver_id\": receiver.user_id, \"message\": message}; returns {\"status\": True, \"message\": \"Message successfully sent to <receiver_name>.\"}"
    ],

    "delete_message(message_id: int) → {\"status\": bool, \"message\": str}": [
      "requires: logged_in==True → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"Device not logged in, unable to delete message\"}",
      "requires: message_id ∈ inbox → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"Message ID does not exist\"}",
      "on_success: delete inbox[message_id]; returns {\"status\": True, \"message\": \"Message ID <id> has been successfully deleted.\"}"
    ],

    "view_messages_between_users(sender_name: str, receiver_name: str) → {\"status\": bool, (\"messages\"|\"message\"): ...}": [
      "requires: logged_in==True → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"Device not logged in, unable to view message information\"}",
      "requires: sender_name ∈ user_name_keys → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"Sender does not exist\"}",
      "requires: receiver_name ∈ user_name_keys → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"Receiver does not exist\"}",
      "returns on success: {\"status\": True, \"messages\": [{\"id\": <int>, \"sender\": <sender_name>, \"receiver\": <receiver_name>, \"message\": <str>}, ...]} (only messages where inbox[*].sender_id==sender.user_id AND receiver_id==receiver.user_id)",
      "returns when none: {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"No related message records found\"}"
    ],

    "search_messages(user_name: str, keyword: str) → {\"status\": bool, (\"messages\"|\"message\"): ...}": [
      "requires: user_name ∈ user_name_keys → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"User does not exist\"}",
      "search scope: messages where sender_id==user.user_id OR receiver_id==user.user_id AND keyword case-insensitive substring of message",
      "returns on success: {\"status\": True, \"messages\": [{\"id\": <int>, \"sender_id\": <str>, \"receiver_id\": <str>, \"message\": <str>}, ...]}",
      "returns when none: {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"No messages found containing the keyword\"}"
    ],

    "get_all_message_times_with_ids() → ({<int>: \"YYYY-MM-DD\"} | {\"status\": False, \"message\": str})": [
      "requires: logged_in==True → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"Device not logged in, unable to retrieve all message times and their corresponding message IDs.\"}",
      "requires: every inbox[*] has key \"time\""
    ],

    "get_latest_message_id() → {\"status\": bool, (\"message\"|\"message_id\"): ...}": [
      "requires: logged_in==True → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"Device not logged in, unable to retrieve the latest sent message ID.\"}",
      "requires: len(inbox) > 0 → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"No message records found\"}",
      "requires: every inbox[*].time exists and matches \"%Y-%m-%d\"",
      "on success: returns {\"status\": True, \"message\": \"The latest message ID is <id>\", \"message_id\": <id>}"
    ],

    "get_earliest_message_id() → {\"status\": bool, (\"message\"|\"message_id\"): ...}": [
      "requires: logged_in==True → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"Device not logged in, unable to retrieve the earliest sent message ID.\"}",
      "requires: len(inbox) > 0 → else {\"status\": False, \"message\": \"No message records found\"}",
      "requires: every inbox[*].time exists and matches \"%Y-%m-%d\"",
      "on success: returns {\"status\": True, \"message\": \"The earliest message ID is <id>\", \"message_id\": <id>}"
    ]
  }
}
